snippet: The four badminton teams that were disqualified Wednesday simply looked at the information presented to them and went in the direction that seemed to have the best chance of leading them to their goal.
abstract: Inside The Rings column asserts that the four badminton teams that were disqualified for deliberately trying to lose their preliminary matches were simply using positioning and strategy for a better chance at winning a gold medal; says that fans should be angry at the organizers who made the situation possible, not the athletes themselves.
lead_paragraph: The four badminton teams that were disqualified Wednesday simply looked at the information presented to them and went in the direction that seemed to have the best chance of leading them to their goal.

headline.seo: Olympic Badminton Teams Had Right Idea by Losing
headline.main: The Goal Is Winning Gold, Not Winning Every Match
headline.print_headline: The Goal Is Winning Gold, Not Winning Every Match
